RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Thibaut VIDAL é professor e pesquisador no Departamento de Informática da PUC-Rio. Anteriormente ele atuava como pesquisador de pós-doutorado no LIDS -- Instituto de Tecnologia de Massachusetts (MIT), EUA. Ele obteve seu Doutorado conjunto em Ciência da Computação pela Universidade de Montreal, e em Otimização e Segurança de Sistemas pela Universidade de Tecnologia de Troyes. Suas principais áreas de pesquisa são: otimização combinatoria, metaheurísticas, busca local, programação inteira e dinâmica, com aplicações em logística, gerenciamento da cadeia de suprimentos, produção, telecomunicações, gestão de emergência, entre outras. Sua tese foi agraciada com cinco prestigiados prêmios em diferentes sociedades científicas, e mencionada na lista de honra do Dean of Postgraduate Studies da Universidade de Montreal. Em Dezembro de 2013, seu trabalho apareceu descrito na página de um dos principais jornais do Canadá, onde o título da materia foi 'The young researcher Thibaut Vidal has found the holy grail of vehicle routing problems' : https://www.cirrelt.ca/Cirrelt/Images/File/DEV2013-12-07-DEC-006b.pdf. Mais informações sobre Thibaut VIDAL podem ser encontradas em http://w1.cirrelt.ca/~vidalt/.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Thibaut VIDAL is professor at the department of computer science of PUC-Rio, Brazil. Previously he was postdoctoral researcher at LIDS -- Massachusetts Institute of Technology, USA. He obtained a joint Ph.D in computer science from the University of Montreal, Canada, and in optimization and security of systems from Troyes University of Technology, France. His main domains of expertise relate to combinatorial optimization, metaheuristics, local search, integer and dynamic programming, continuous optimization, with applications to logistics and supply chain management, production, resource allocation, signal processing, and machine learning, among others. His thesis work was recompensed by five prestigious dissertation prizes in different scientific societies, and is now mentioned in the honor list of the Dean of Postgraduate Studies, University of Montreal. In December 2013, his work was described in full page in a newspaper of Quebec, titling 'The young researcher Thibaut Vidal has found the ''holy grail'' of vehicle routing problems'. More information can be found at http://w1.cirrelt.ca/~vidalt/.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: New approaches for modeling and resolution of home delivery problems
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This project focuses on the development of new approaches to better address home delivery problem which, following the widespread advent of electronic commerce, have experienced a surge in the last decade. Part of the work will focus on the modeling of these problems, drawing a special attention to the objectives pursued by shippers. The rest of the project will focus on the development of state-of-the-art heuristics and meta-heuristics for an effective resolution of large-scale problems.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: New approaches for modeling and resolution of home delivery problems

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Optimizing Freight Transportation: Models and Algorithms
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: In production industry, the transportation of the freight easily amounts to 10% of the total product cost, as documented, e.g., by the European Commission. Moreover, the largest amount of products are nowadays transported by road, and this increases not only costs, but also pollution, traffic jams, and accidents, considerably worsening the quality of life of the areas involved by the transportation process. Two main options are available to increase the efficiency of the transportation process. The first one is to build new infrastructures, such as highways, that speed up the connections between cities. Brazil is already investing much in this process, but this comes at a high cost. The second option is to optimize the transportation of freight, by using tools that allow companies and local authorities to perform their distribution process in the best possible way. This involves producing mathematical models that can replicate the behavior of the distribution systems, and developing algorithms that can solve the models and find the best way to perform the distribution. Clearly the optimization of freight transportation combines well with the process of building new highways, but has the advantage of requiring much cheaper costs. Moreover, the gains in efficiency that can be obtained are so important that the optimization of freight transportation is considered one of the key points for a sustainable logistics, as discussed by the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development. The activity we propose in this three-year project has a twofold objective. The first one is that of producing new mathematical models and efficient algorithms for the solution of some important optimization problems arising in the field of freight transportation. In particular, we intend to develop solution tools that can be used by companies and local authorities to perform their distributions in the best possible ways, so reducing product cost, pollution, traffic jams, and accidents. More in details, we expect to produce solution tools that output precise distribution plans, that include the detailed scheduling of the activities (where and when products have to be loaded on a commercial vehicle/truck, and where and when they have to be unloaded) and the routing of the vehicles (which path should be used by each vehicle to perform its list of scheduled activities). The second objective is to transfer technology and scientific knowledge to the Operations Research group of the Universidade Federal da Paraíba. This group is young, well-motivated, and is growing fast, especially in the field of heuristic algorithms. These algorithms are usually very effective in the solution of large problems, but sometimes lack in accuracy and scientific rigor. The combination of heuristic with exact algorithms and mathematical models may lead to much better results, allowing to obtain at the same time solutions that are more accurate and more robust. The collaboration with a talented team of researchers from abroad, specialized in exact algorithms and mathematical models, would allow the Brazilian group to enrich their capabilities. It would fasten up their development and improve their scientific independence, increasing their potential to publish articles in international journals and to solve real-world problems, thus contributing to the wealth of the Brazilian north-east area. This project is supported by CAPES (PVE A007_2013)..

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Algoritmos eficientes para resolução de problemas de roteamento de veículos
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Descrição: O Problema de Roteamento de Veículos (PRV) é um problema clássico de otimização combinatória proposto no final da década de 1950, sendo ainda um dos mais estudados na área de Pesquisa Operacional. O elevado interesse no PRV é devido a sua importância prática, bem como a dificuldade em resolvê-lo. Este projeto trata de algoritmos eficientes para PRVs com ênfase em variantes propostas recentemente na literatura, a saber: PRV que leva em conta emissões de poluição (PRV-Pol), PRV Clusterizado (PRV-Clu), Problema do Caixeiro Viajante com Limites de Carga (PCVLC) e Problema de Roteamento e Scheduling de Advogados. Apesar do escopo principal do projeto estar voltado para variantes recentes do PRV, há também intenção de estudar as variantes consideradas clássicas como o PRV com Frota Heterogêna (PRFVH) e extensões, PRV com Entregas Fracionárias (PRVEF), além de aplicações reais do PRV na indústria. Os metódos de resolução a serem utilizados são baseados em abordagens heurísticas, exatas e híbridas. A equipe deste projeto é composta por pesquisadores de diversas instituições federais do Brasil, tais como UFF, UFV e UFOP, além de contar com pesquisadores de instituições internacionais especialistas em roteamento de veículos. A duração do projeto está prevista para 24 meses.. Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Algoritmos eficientes para resolução de problemas de roteamento de veículos

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio de Janeiro

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Solving some new and existing variants of routing problems -- NAFOSTED -- Vietnam
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Routing problem is one of most important and studied problems in Operations Research (OR). It calls for the determination of the optimal set of routes to be performed by a fleet of vehicles to serve a given set of customers. Depending on each application, a customer can be modeled by a vertex or an edge (arc) in a graph.
More than 55 years have elapsed since Dantzig and Ramser introduced the problem in 1959. Since then, many variants have been introduced and studied in the literature to better deal with real-world problems. In recent industrial applications carried out when we studied and worked abroad, we have been confronted with two new variants of routing problems:
* Vehicle Routing Problem with Service Levels (VRP-SL): The vertices of a graph are devised into several groups, each with a given service level representing the minimum requested ratio of deliveries that must be fulfilled. The objective is to find a minimum length set of vehicle routes passing through a subset of vertices subject to constraints on the vehicle capacity and the service level requirement for each groups.
* Hierarchical Vehicle Routing Problem (HVRP): In this problem, the vertices of a graph are partitioned into clusters with decreasing priority levels. The problem involves finding a set of vehicle routes passing through all the vertices such that the completion time of the first class, then second class, and so on are minimized. This project aims to address these interesting variants and introduce them to the OR community. Moreover, we also consider existing VRP variants which have recently received much attention of the community:
* Covering Tour Problem (CTP): The problem involves finding a minimum length set of vehicle routes passing through a subset of vertices, subject to constraints on the length of each route and the number of vertices that it contains, such that each vertex not included in any route called a customer lies within a given distance of a route.
* Time-Dependent Arc Routing Problem (TD-ARP): The problem is similar to a classical arc routing problem, except that arc traversal times now are not fixed and may vary over the planning horizon. Our goal here is to develop new algorithms that improve and outperform current state-of-the-art algorithms proposed in the literature for these problems.
In this project, we mainly use modern, advanced and state-of-the-art methods which have solved successfully many other VRP variants: branch-and-cut, branch-and-price, for exact solutions; and genetic algorithm for approximate solutions.

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: National Foundation for Science and Technology Development

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: FAPERJ -- Jovem Cientista do Nosso Estado : Meta^2 -- Meta-heuristicas hibridas para problemas combinatorios em grande escala
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The goal of this project is to address large-scale combinatorial optimization problems which arise from the field of transportation, logistics, scheduling and computer graphics by means of heuristics, metaheuristics and mathematical programming. Many of these application fields are critical for the development of the state of Rio de Janeiro. This research is based on bio-inspired algorithms such as genetic algorithms and ant-colony optimization, which are combined (hybridized) with local search, dynamic programming and exact methods. Such hybrid heuristics are able to locate, with high-probability, good solutions in a very large space of possibilities, which is often much larger than the number of atoms in the visible universe.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: FAPERJ -- Jovem Cientista do Nosso Estado : Meta^2 -- Meta-heuristicas hibridas para problemas combinatorios em grande escala

Producing new optimization softwares that crunch massive amounts of data, helping evaluating strategic decisions, and contributing to cut off 4-6% costs on operations worth of several millions dollars per day while consolidating customer service quality and reliability.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: On the integration of Operations Research and Machine Learning techniques
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The first objective of the project is to study the integration of Operations Research (OR) and Machine Learning (ML) techniques to solve several important problems of both domains as well as to solve problems of other fields such as economics, transportation, and manufacturing, etc. More precisely, we will design and develop new algorithms based on OR techniques to improve ML algorithms, and vice-versa new algorithms based on ML techniques to improve OR methods. Our main goal here is to provide new algorithms that outperform current ones proposed in the literature. Furthermore, we integrate both techniques to solve several hard decision-making problems arising in a number of domains such as economics, transportation, etc. To attain our objectives, we adapt modern and advanced methods by integrating new algorithmic features which exploit unique characteristics of each problem. The second objective is training postgraduate students who can work, do research and solve real-world optimization problems in the near future. The last objective is to gather several Operations Research (OR) researchers collaborating in a favorable research environment to build up a strong group working on the applied combinatorial optimization in Vietnam.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: On the integration of Operations Research and Machine Learning techniques

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO: Large-Scale Optimization of Car-Hauling Networks. Large project (500-1000h) to develop an optimization software to produce real-time itineraries for 3000 drivers and around 80.000 weekly deliveries for a major car-hauling company. Large set of operational constraints. Delivery of a prototype, teamwork and support for maintenance and integration.
